sources.data_found: 2022 Degrees Awarded data: Computer Science (247 Bachelor, 588 Master, 11 PhD); Software Engineering (80 Bachelor, 109 Master).

student_data.notes: Exact current enrollment counts for the CS department are not centralized on a single public page. Counts are estimated based on 'Degrees Awarded' data (2022) from DataUSA/IPEDS. Undergraduate Estimate: (247 CS Bachelors + 80 Software Eng Bachelors) × 4 years = 1,308. Master's Estimate: (588 CS Masters + 109 Software Eng Masters) × 1.5 years duration = 1,045. PhD Estimate: 11 CS PhDs awarded × 5 years duration = 55.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Located in the 2 Visualization nodes of the Grace cluster (2 nodes × 2 GPUs/node).

gpu_resources.notes:
Primary campus cluster is 'Grace'. Specs explicitly list:
1. GPU Partition: 10 nodes × 2 NVIDIA Tesla V100 GPUs = 20 V100s.
2. Visualization Partition: 2 nodes × 2 NVIDIA Quadro RTX 8000 GPUs = 4 RTX 8000s.
No public documentation was found regarding on-premise deployments of A100 or H100 clusters as of search date; Stevens may utilize cloud resources or partner facilities for newer generation hardware. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: Data collected from Stevens Research Computing Technical Documentation (GitHub Pages) and DataUSA. The Grace cluster is the only publicly documented centralized HPC resource.
